hanzi-su-wiki:
飲

Значения

Пить

Мнемоника


Кто-то ест 食 и пьёт, широко открыв рот 欠.

Варианты

飮, 饮
purpleculture_pinyin:
yǐn
to drink
пить

yìn
to give (animals) water to drink
поить (животных) водой
rtega_mnemonic:
飲飲RS
X		drink
  • done while eating 食 with the mouth open 欠; porters 欠 must drink often
 召 喫

飲飲RS
饮饮		drink, swallow, kind of drink
  • while eating 飠 a man 人 opens his mouth ⺈ to swallow or drink: he lacks 欠 fluid or food
 召 喫
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 饮)
Pictophonetic: 欠 indicates the sound; 飠 (food) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
飲食 [ yǐn shí ]: food and drink; diet
飲料 [ yǐn liào ]: drink; beverage
飲用 [ yǐn yòng ]: drink; drinking or drinkable (water)
飲酒 [ yǐn jiǔ ]: to drink wine
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 欠 [ qiàn ] to lack, to owe; to breathe, to yawn
heisig_chinese_memo: When you lack food, just drink a beverage to fill you up.
heisig_constituent: drink, eat, food, umbrella, good, halo, drop, silver, lack, yawn
koohiiStory1: My experience with Japanese enkais (dinner parties): plenty to drink drink drink, but a severe lack of food, T_T.
koohiiStory2: When you lack food, just drink something to fill you up.
jp_example_words:
飲み込む(のみこむ): to gulp down, to swallow deeply, to understand, to take in, to catch on to, to learn, to digest
湯飲み(ゆのみ): teacup
飲み物(のみもの): drink, beverage
飲む(のむ): to drink
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You can eat all you want, but you'll still lack something to drink. You can't live just from eating, you have to drink things too!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine eating and eating and lacking a delicious, cold, thirst-quenching drink. Your mouth is dry. You have to drink something, anything!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You get desperate for a drink and put some nori (の) seaweed in a blender, trying to create a drink of your own.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Luckily, this nori isn't dried and pressed like they usually are, and you manage to make a bright green nori drink. You gulp it down, and even though it tastes like the ocean, it hits the spot!
Ru_trainchinese:
yǐn: (графема) пить, выпивать; напиток; таить в себе, прятать; (кит. мед.) настой, отвар; (кит. мед.) жидкая мокрота
yìn: (глаг) давать (животным) воды для питья
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if there's a lack (欠) to eat (飠), you drink
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If you yawn and think you need food, sometimes all you really need is a beverage to get your energy back up.
humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from the " unitary " from the " people " bow from ◎, Elephant Man, mouth Shenshe, in respect of drinking wine, wine droplets as small dots or oral fluid, the original meaning is drinking. Bronze leaned humanoid rewrite "is less ", " less " is also a " drink " of sound symbols; Shenshe down and rewrite shaped mouth near the " Today ", but also as phonetic, whole word can scribe as "㱃". From the "酓" on the left side of the bronze inscription, to the regular script is changed to "食".

Jia Jinwen said to drink, "Collection" 10405 replied: "The rainbow comes from the north, drinking in the river." It means that a rainbow appears in the north and drinking water in the river. The ancients believed that the rainbow on the stream was like a drinking creature. See " Rainbow ". Yu Yin [辶成] Er Zhong: "Happy my father and brother, 㱃 (drink) 飤 (food) 诃 (song) 𨖴 (dance)." Means to entertain my father and brother, eating, singing and dancing.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period also expressed drinking, "Tsinghua Jane II. Jane 26-27: "Sai (Xi) Hou Yiwen King Drinks" means that Xi Hou entertains King Chu Wen to drink. "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 3: "Drink and eat (food)." "Shangbo Bamboo Book Five. "Three Virtues" Jane 7: "Where to drink (food) is unlimited meter", Jane 11: "Don't drink to eat (food)" "Shangbo Bamboo Book Five. "Ghosts of Ming Rongshi You Chengshi" Jane 6: "Fuyin Fuxian (food)".

"Said Wen": "㱃, 歠 Ye. From the owe, the sound. All the belongings of the 㱃 are from the 㱃. 𣲎, the ancient text 㱃 from the present, water. 𩚜, the ancient text from the present, food.

" Drink " is also used as a noun. Today's Min dialect uses " Drink " to mean rice soup, which is the reservation of its noun usage.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from the " unitary " from the " people " bow from ◎, Elephant Man, mouth Shenshe, in respect of drinking wine, wine droplets as small dots or oral fluid, the original meaning is drinking.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「酉」從「人」從◎，象人俯首，張口伸舌，喝酒尊裏的酒，小點象酒滴或口液，本義是飲酒。金文俯身的人形改寫為「欠」，「欠」亦是「飲」的聲符；倒口和伸舌改寫為形近的「今」，也作為聲旁，全字可隸定為「㱃」。金文左邊所從的「酓」，至楷書改為「食」。

　　甲金文表示飲，《合集》10405反：「出虹自北，飲于河。」表示北方出現彩虹，在河中飲水。古人認為溪澗上的彩虹象飲水的生物。參見「虹」。余贎[辶乘]兒鐘：「樂我父兄，㱃(飲)飤(食)訶(歌)𨖴(舞)。」表示娛樂我的父兄，飲食歌舞。

　　戰國竹簡也表示飲，《清華簡二．繫年》簡26-27：「賽(息)侯以文王飲酒」，表示息侯招待楚文王飲酒。《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡3：「飲而飤(食)之」。《上博竹書五．三德》簡7：「凡飤(食)飲無量計」，簡11：「不飲弗飤(食)」。《上博竹書五．鬼神之明 融師有成氏》簡6：「弗飲弗飤(食)」。

　　《說文》：「㱃，歠也。从欠，酓聲。凡㱃之屬皆从㱃。𣲎，古文㱃从今、水。𩚜，古文㱃从今、食。」

　　「飲」還有名詞用法，今閩語以「飲」表示米湯，正是其名詞用法的保留。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「酉」從「人」從◎，象人俯首，張口伸舌，喝酒尊裏的酒，小點象酒滴或口液，本義是飲酒。

  • Pinyin: yìn

    English Definition: to give (animals) water to drink

(Simplified: 饮)
Pictophonetic: 欠 indicates the sound; 飠 (food) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 飠 [ shí ] food; to eat
    • 欠 [ qiàn ] to lack, to owe; to breathe, to yawn
①喝，又特指喝酒：飲水思源。飲酒。飲泣(淚流滿面，流到口裏，形容悲哀到了極點)。飲鴆止渴。
②指可喝的東西：冷飲。飲料。飲食。
③中醫湯劑的一種類型：香蘇飲。飲子(不規定時間服用的湯劑)。
④中醫學指體內水液傳輸不利停於腹腔或四肢的病症：痰飲。懸飲。溢飲。
⑤含忍：飲恨。飲譽(享有盛名，受到稱讚)。
⑥隱沒：飲羽。
飲食 [ yǐn shí ]: food and drink; diet
飲料 [ yǐn liào ]: drink; beverage
飲用 [ yǐn yòng ]: drink; drinking or drinkable (water)
飲酒 [ yǐn jiǔ ]: to drink wine
①把水給人或牲畜喝。［合］飲羊(指羊販讓羊多飲水，增加其體重以牟利。後引申爲欺詐牟利)；飲水(給牲口喝水)；飲馬長江(在長江邊給戰馬喝水。指渡江南下進行征伐)。
②用酒食款待。［合］飲客(用酒食款待客人)；飲勞(以酒食慰勞)。
(Simplified: 饮)

甲骨文從「 酉 」從「 人 」從◎，象人俯首，張口伸舌，喝酒尊裏的酒，小點象酒滴或口液，本義是飲酒。金文俯身的人形改寫為「 欠 」，「 欠 」亦是「 飲 」的聲符；倒口和伸舌改寫為形近的「 今 」，也作為聲旁，全字可隸定為「 㱃 」。金文左邊所從的「 酓 」，至楷書改為「 食 」。 甲金文表示飲，《合集》10405反：「出虹自北，飲于河。」表示北方出現彩虹，在河中飲水。古人認為溪澗上的彩虹象飲水的生物。參見「 虹 」。余贎[辶乘]兒鐘：「樂我父兄，㱃(飲)飤(食)訶(歌)𨖴(舞)。」表示娛樂我的父兄，飲食歌舞。 戰國竹簡也表示飲，《清華簡二．繫年》簡26-27：「賽(息)侯以文王飲酒」，表示息侯招待楚文王飲酒。《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡3：「飲而飤(食)之」。《上博竹書五．三德》簡7：「凡飤(食)飲無量計」，簡11：「不飲弗飤(食)」。《上博竹書五．鬼神之明 融師有成氏》簡6：「弗飲弗飤(食)」。 《說文》：「㱃，歠也。从欠，酓聲。凡㱃之屬皆从㱃。𣲎，古文㱃从今、水。𩚜，古文㱃从今、食。」 「 飲 」還有名詞用法，今閩語以「 飲 」表示米湯，正是其名詞用法的保留。

From the " 酓" on the left side of the bronze inscription, to the regular script is changed to " 食". Jia Jinwen said to drink, "Collection" 10405 replied: "The rainbow comes from the north, drinking in the river." It means that a rainbow appears in the north and drinking water in the river. 飲字的基本解释

飲
yǐn

飲
yìn
均见“饮”。

飲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǐn］
［《廣韻》於錦切，上寢，影。］
亦作“淾1”。亦作“1”。“饮1”的繁体字。亦作“飮1”。
(1)喝。
(2)专指喝酒。
(3)犹吸。
(4)漱。
(5)隐没。
(6)受；享受。
(7)含忍。参见“飲恨”。
(8)酒。
(9)指水。
(10)泛指饮料，浆汤。
(11)指酒席。
(12)指饮酒礼。
(13)中医指一种服用不定时不定量的汤药。
(14)中医病证名。
[②]［yìn］
［《廣韻》於禁切，去沁，影。］
亦作“淾2”。“饮2”的繁体字。亦作“飮2”。
(1)给人、畜喝水。
(2)以酒食款待，宴请，行饮酒礼。
(3)使滋润不干枯。
(4)谓满足。
(5)度声。古代指调试乐调。

飲字的康熙字典解释
飲字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
飲字的起名意思

暂无。

drink
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yǐn］
["Guangyun" Yu Jinqie, go to bed, shadow. ]
Also known as "Song 1". Also called "1". Traditional characters for "酒1". Also known as "飮1".
(1) Drink.
(2) Specifically refers to drinking.
(3) Still sucking.
(4) Rinsing.
(5) Hidden.
(6) Accept; enjoy.
(7) With forbearance. See "Hate Drinking".
(8) Wine.
(9) Refers to water.
(10) Refers to beverages and soups in general.
(11) Refers to banquets.
(12) Refers to drinking rituals.
(13) Traditional Chinese Medicine refers to a decoction that is taken irregularly and irregularly.
(14) TCM disease name.
[②]［yìn］
["Guangyun" in Jinqie, go to Qin, shadow. ]
Also known as "Song 2". Traditional characters for "Drink 2". Also known as "飮2".
(1) Drink water for people and animals.
(2) Treats with wine and food, banquets, and drinking rituals.
(3) Keep the moisture from drying out.
(4) Said to be satisfied.
(5) Degree sound. In ancient times, it refers to tuning tunes.

yǐn, yìn
вм. 饮

飲

Значения

Пить

Мнемоника


Кто-то ест 食 и пьёт, широко открыв рот 欠.

Варианты

飮, 饮

Radicals: 食, 欠  (eat, lack)
Meaning Mnemonic
You can eat all you want, but you'll still lack something to drink. You can't live just from eating, you have to drink things too!
Imagine eating and eating and lacking a delicious, cold, thirst-quenching drink. Your mouth is dry. You have to drink something, anything!
Reading Mnemonic
You get desperate for a drink and put some nori (の) seaweed in a blender, trying to create a drink of your own.
Luckily, this nori isn't dried and pressed like they usually are, and you manage to make a bright green nori drink. You gulp it down, and even though it tastes like the ocean, it hits the spot!

Examples: 飲む (の.む)
欠 (недостача), 食 (еда)
